entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, a young boy who receives letters in green ink.

entities.name: uncle vernon
entities.description: Harry's uncle, who is trying to prevent Harry from receiving letters in green ink. He is described as shouting at Harry and trying to tear up the letters.

entities.name: aunt petunia
entities.description: Harry's aunt, who is skeptical of Uncle Vernon's plan to prevent Harry from receiving letters in green ink. She brings him a piece of fruit cake while he is trying to nail up the letter-box.

entities.name: frui t cake
entities.description: A type of baked good that Aunt Petunia brings to Uncle Vernon, which he uses as a makeshift hammer to try and knock in a nail.

relationships.description: Uncle Vernon is trying to prevent Harry from receiving letters in green ink, and he shouts at him for about half an hour.
Harry receives letters in green ink, which are addressed to him. Uncle Vernon tries to prevent these letters from being delivered.
Aunt Petunia is skeptical of Uncle Vernon's plan to prevent Harry from receiving letters in green ink, and she expresses her concerns to him.
Harry receives letters in green ink, which are addressed to him. These letters arrive at his home despite Uncle Vernon's attempts to prevent them from being delivered.
Uncle Vernon tries to prevent the letters in green ink from being delivered to Harry. He tears up the letters and nails up the letter-box.
